name: inexcusably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is too bad to be accepted or forgiven: The project is inexcusably overdue. He has an inexcusably cavalier attitude about disability and pension issues. See
inexcusable
More examplesFewer examplesInexcusably, we weren't given enough light for reading.His parenting philosophy left his children inexcusably ill-prepared for adulthood.It took almost two years, an inexplicably and inexcusably long time, to complete the update.
